contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 7, 1869 D Wortley & Armley Contest
Wortley & Armley Contest 0 Other
wortley-armley-contest
None
Own Choice Test Piece Contest
Carr Crofts, Armley See http://www.ibew.org.uk/misc4286.htm Flower Show + Band Contest - Wortley & Armley This show was brought to a close by a brass band contest, the competitors being the Dewsbury Old Band, Black Dyke Mills Band, Leeds Model Band, and Mr Porritt's Armley Band. The judge was Mr. J. S. Jones, master of the band of the Fifth Dragoons, now stationed in Leeds. The whole of the hands played their various pieces in a first class style; and received the well merited applause of the numerous company present. The Dewsbury band took the first prize of £15; Black Dyke second, £10; and the Leeds Model third, .£5. After the band contest, there was a solo soprano cornet contest, in which there there were five competitors; Mr. Charles Anby, of the Dewsbury Old Band taking the prize, value £8.8s. After the contest, the whole of the bands contesting played unitedly Handel's "Hallelujah", "Rule Britannia", and the "National Anthem". 4 bands competed
Nov. 11, 2011, 2:37 p.m. Nov. 18, 2016, 12:30 p.m.
1 Dewsbury Old Band Unknown 'Worthy is the Lamb' from 'The Messiah' [unknown arranger]
2 Black Dyke Band Unknown Maritana [unknown arranger]
3 Yorkshire Evening Post Band Unknown Herculaneum
4 Messrs. Porritt and Withams (Armley) Unknown Lucrezia Borgia [unknown arranger]
